rounds.category: YOU ONLY NEED TO BUY 1 VOWEL
rounds.comments: (Alex: And the reason you only need to buy one is because there's just one vowel in each correct response.)

clues.text: It means shining & precedes "-eyed & bushy-tailed"
When both people pay for dinner on a date, they go this nationality (& home alone, probably)
A rough cabin or shanty; in song, the "love" this "is a little old place where we can get together"
A quick search of a person for concealed weapons
We bet you're "itching" to say it means to withdraw an entry from a race
Rocco Landesman, a producer of Broadway's "The Producers", was named to chair this federal arts organization
"Mucho Gustavo", said L.A. music lovers as 28-year-old conductor Gustavo Dudamel took over this orchestra
In London Oscar winner Rachel Weisz took on this iconic stage role in "A Streetcar Named Desire"
Children in Belfast made a 22,500-square-foot artwork using this juvenile type of painting
To honor the 400th anniv. of Hudson sailing to NYC from this Dutch city, Vermeer's "The Milkmaid" took the same trip
Early in his career, he "walked the line" with the Tennessee Two
The Jordanaires have been called "the sound behind the King" for their work with him
This "Soul Brother Number One" was backed by the Famous Flames & the JBs
This backing band includes saxophonist Clarence Clemons & guitarist Steve Van Zandt
He's worked with both The Attractions & The Imposters
The third longest-serving senator in history, Kennedy represented this state for 47 years
Destined for a political career, Ted Kennedy was born Feb. 22, 1932, the 200th anniv. of this president's birth
This governor said Uncle Teddy was "a liberal icon, a warrior for the less fortunate... the rock of his family"
Kennedy called this the cause of his life & was hoping to see a reform bill passed before he died
After a funeral mass in Boston, Ted was laid to rest near John & Bobby at this cemetery
It's a nickname for the U.S. flag
These fruit chews by Wrigley are advertised as "a pack of contradictions"
This multiple-armed marine animal is harmful to oyster beds but tough to eradicate, since it can regenerate body parts
Both Barbra Streisand & Kris Kristofferson won Golden Globe awards for their roles in this 1976 musical remake
Meaning "ill-fated" & usually paired with "lovers", this term was used by Shakespeare in his prologue to "Romeo and Juliet"
In March 2009 this ex of Kid Rock & Tommy Lee blogged on her views about stem cell research
He may have rapped "U Can't Touch This" but U can read his blog on blogspot.com
His bloggings included "The 3 D's of real estate" & "Why I selected Dennis Rodman" for his TV show
This actress' ex, Paul Simon, "would sing me to sleep, which was... sweet or... annoying, depending on the album"
Go to huffingtonpost.com for the blogging of this "30 Rock" Emmy winner

Tennis, anyone? How about golf, football, baseball...:
SI

LHJ

Covering movies, TV, books...:
EW

For science, technology, automotive & more:
PM

BW
An old proverb says not to do this "until you come to it"
In sewing & embroidery, it forms an "X"
The Vasa race in Sweden, an event in this winter sport, takes place over a 56-mile course
This weapon was outlawed by the Lateran council of 1139
At the 1896 DNC, William Jennings Bryan told delegates, "You shall not crucify mankind on" one of these
If you hit an HR in MLB, you're going to have to run this many feet to get home
Hr. corresponds to this German title of respect
This business services & tax prep company also operates under the brand RSM McGladrey
The American recovery & reinvestment act of 2009 was H.R. 1; the "H.R." stood for this
Hertzsprung-Russell, or HR, diagrams are used in, & named for 2 men in, this scientific field
Alexander II's Edict of Emancipation freed these workers whose status was similar to slaves
This Moscow landmark has served as the official residence of the president since 1991
In 1908 this Siberian mystic brought some comfort to Alexis, the hemophiliac heir to the Russian throne
It's how you say "goodbye" in Russian
The basin of this river that empties into the Caspian Sea contains almost half of the Russian Republic's population
The first woman to teach at the Sorbonne, she published a treatise on radioactivity in 1910
Einstein said this 17th & 18th c. physicist "stands before us, strong, certain and alone"
The Dept. of the Interior has an annual lecture named for this biologist; she worked for the Dept. in the 1940s
The surname of this 16th century Polish astronomer means "one who works with copper"
In WWII this Danish physicist worked on the Manhattan Project under the assumed name Nicholas Baker for security reasons
Starscream, Frenzy & Bumblebee are but a few of the metalheads in this 2007 Michael Bay movie
Keanu gets upstaged by Gort, a silent, expressionless mechanical giant, in this 2008 remake
At the beginning of a 1999 sequel, this title hero discovers that his new wife Vanessa is actually a fembot
Introduced in 1977, this robot got his name from the map coordinates of a post office
At the end of this 1927 film, Maria & her robot twin are stalked by mobs as disaster strikes the title city

rounds.text: This antelope has 2 names, one from Afrikaans describing its looks & one imitating its sound; one is all we need
